snippet: The pro-government forces were seen as getting a morale boost, while some rebel leaders called on fighters to end their divisions in the face of the latest threat.

byline.contributor: Kareem Fahim reported from Beirut, and Anne Barnard from Istanbul. Reporting was contributed by Hwaida Saad and Karam Shoumali from Istanbul; Maher Samaan from Beirut; and Omar Al-Jawoshy from Baghdad.
byline.original: By KAREEM FAHIM and ANNE BARNARD

abstract: Syrian government forces and their allies are attempting to advance on contested city of Aleppo with aid from Russian warplanes and helicopters; offensive is indication of degree to which Russian support has emboldened Syrian forces in fight against Islamic State.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: The pro-government forces were seen as getting a morale boost, while some rebel leaders called on fighters to end their divisions in the face of the latest threat.

headline.print_headline: Russians Make an Impact in Syrian Battle for Control of Aleppo
headline.main: Russia Makes an Impact in Syrian Battle for Control of Aleppo
